name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 4-decylphenyl and methyl substitutions generally lower the melting point compared to a phenyl group, as they reduce the crystal lattice stability and increase the molecular weight. Each decyl group can lower the melting point by approximately -10°C due to reduced crystal lattice stability and increased molecular weight. The methyl group also contributes to a slight decrease in melting point due to its smaller size and reduced molecular weight.
